title: Ticket #2463: condor_q -dag incorrectly assigns node jobs
description:
Here's some output from condor_q -dag on submit.chtc: 

  ...
  4094706.0   bt              9/13 14:29   0+00:17:13 R  0   12.2 condor_dagman -f -
  4094707.0    |-dataset_one  9/13 14:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  process.pl dataset
  4094708.0    |-dataset_one  9/13 14:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  process.pl dataset
  4094709.0    |-dataset_one  9/13 14:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  process.pl dataset
  4094710.0    |-dataset_one  9/13 14:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  process.pl dataset
  4094711.0    |-dataset_one  9/13 14:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  process.pl dataset
  4094712.0    |-dataset_one  9/13 14:29   0+00:00:00 I  0   0.0  process.pl dataset
  4094716.0    |-sim001       9/13 14:33   0+00:03:04 R  0   1.2  ffsm_sphr.exe ./ .
  4094717.0    |-sim002       9/13 14:33   0+00:03:04 R  0   1.2  ffsm_sphr.exe ./ .
  4094718.0    |-sim003       9/13 14:33   0+00:03:04 R  0   1.2  ffsm_sphr.exe ./ .
  ...

The sim... nodes don't belong to bt's DAG (as confirmed by looking at the DAGManJobId values in their classads), but condor_q -dag incorrectly groups them under that DAG.
remarks:
2011-Dec-19 09:34:55 by nwp:
Did this get fixed by #1281?

2011-Dec-19 10:37:11 by nwp:
I am looking at the submit host at chtc. This case seems to happen if the condor_dagman process dies. I do not believe my code for #1281 fixes this.

2011-Dec-19 12:13:58 by nwp:
I submitted a new build to batlab, with a patch that will fix this, I believe.

2011-Dec-19 22:27:59 by nwp:
I have verified that my patch to condor_q fixes this problem. The new version of condor_q can be run on the CHTC submit node with the following commands: 
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/lib64:/usr/lib64:/usr/lib64/condor:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
~nwp/condor_q -dag
